what: ggplot plug in to add Letters of Significance
title: ggplot plug in to add Letters of Significance
text: goal ggls add letter indicating significance differences results among treatments displayed ggplot barplots boxplots.

title: ggplot plug in to add Letters of Significance
text: can install development version ggls GitHub :

title: ggplot plug in to add Letters of Significance
text: want use ggpubr package, may need create list comparisons groups want compare. want compare groups , command . Additionally, using ggpubr, may want test common assumptions common statistical tests dataset. test_assumptions function . ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. devtools::build_readme() handy .
code: library(ggls)  comparison_maker(ToothGrowth, supp) #> [[1]] #> [1] "OJ" "VC" test_assumptions(ToothGrowth, supp, len) #> [1] "Shapiro Test indicates non-normal distribution in the data" #> [1] "Variance Test indicates equal variances in the data" #>      Assumption          Decision #> [1,] "Shapiro Normality" "Fail"   #> [2,] "Levene Variance"   "Pass"

title: Comparison Maker — comparison_maker
text: data dataset inputting x column name contains groups wanting compare comparisons Default "". want compare variables within grouping column, can specify comparisons want instead.

title: Test Assumptions — test_assumptions
code: test_assumptions(data, x, y, groups = NULL, alpha = 0.05, plots = FALSE)

title: Test Assumptions — test_assumptions
text: data dataset analyzed x X variable y Y (response) variable groups Grouping variable, applicable. Default = NULL alpha Alpha p-value evaluations. Default = 0.05 plots Choose whether include diagnostic plots case assumptions met. Default = T

title: Test Assumptions — test_assumptions
code: test_assumptions(ToothGrowth, supp, len, dose, alpha = 0.01) #> [1] "Shapiro Test indicates normal distribution in the data" #> [1] "Variance Test indicates equal variances in the data" #>      Assumption          Decision #> [1,] "Shapiro Normality" "Pass"   #> [2,] "Levene Variance"   "Pass"
